snippet: A suit against the armed forces argues that many Vietnam veterans had post-traumatic stress disorder when they were issued other-than-honorable discharges.
abstract: Class-action lawsuit filed against American armed forces argues many Vietnam veterans suffering from post-traumatic stress disorder were issued other-than-honorable discharges and demands their discharges be upgraded; suit raises questions about whether PTSD can be diagnosed retroactively, and whether policies intended to protect troops with PTSD can be applied retroactively as well.
lead_paragraph: A suit against the armed forces argues that many Vietnam veterans had post-traumatic stress disorder when they were issued other-than-honorable discharges.

headline.seo: Vietnam Veterans, Claiming PTSD, Sue for Better Discharges
headline.main: Vietnam Veterans, Discharged Under Cloud, File Suit Saying Trauma Was Cause
headline.print_headline: Vietnam Veterans, Discharged Under Cloud, File Suit Saying Trauma Was Cause

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject
